page.title: 12FARMING
page.content: Farmland covers most of our survey area and the farms vary in size and in production.There are some small- holdings in the area, but the majority of the farms are in the medium to large class by Cornish standards i.e. 200 acres approx.There is some beef production and some sheep rearing and much of the area is intensively farmed grassland as a result.The greater part of the land is however given over to the production of crops other than grass.The climate of the area encourages early crops and potatoes are very common.Other crops much in evidence are barley,cauliflower,peas, winter cauliflower,and other varieties of brassica.
